edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.symmetricCrypto.encryption

Class OpenSSLEncWithIVAbs

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.symmetricCrypto.encryption.OpenSSLEncWithIVAbs
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SymmetricEnc, Eav, EncSecLevel, Indistinguishable, SecurityLevel
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    OpenSSLCBCEncRandomIV, OpenSSLCTREncRandomIV

    public abstract class OpenSSLEncWithIVAbs
extends java.lang.Object
implements SymmetricEnc
    This is an abstract class that manage the common behavior of symmetric encryption using Open SSL library. We implemented symmetric encryption using OpenSSL with two modes of operations - CBC and CTR, each one has a unique derived class.
    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

      Sets the name of a Pseudorandom permutation and the name of a Random Number Generator Algorithm to use to generate the source of randomness.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OpenSSLEncWithIVAbs

        public OpenSSLEncWithIVAbs(PseudorandomPermutation prp)
        Gets the name of the underlying prp that determines the type of encryption that will be performed. A default source of randomness is used.
        Parameters:
        prp - the underlying pseudorandom permutation to get the name of.

      • OpenSSLEncWithIVAbs

        public OpenSSLEncWithIVAbs(PseudorandomPermutation prp,
                   java.security.SecureRandom random)
        Gets the name of the underlying prp that determines the type of encryption that will be performed. The random passed to this constructor determines the source of randomness that will be used.
        Parameters:
        prp - the underlying pseudorandom permutation to get the name of.
        random - a user provided source of randomness.

      • OpenSSLEncWithIVAbs

        public OpenSSLEncWithIVAbs(java.lang.String prpName,
                   java.lang.String randNumGenAlg)
                    throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Sets the name of a Pseudorandom permutation and the name of a Random Number Generator Algorithm to use to generate the source of randomness.

        Parameters:
        prpName - the name of a specific Pseudorandom permutation, for example "AES".
        randNumGenAlg - the name of the RNG algorithm, for example "SHA1PRNG".
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the given randNumGenAlg is not a valid random number generator.

      • OpenSSLEncWithIVAbs

        public OpenSSLEncWithIVAbs(java.lang.String prpName,
                   java.security.SecureRandom random)
        Sets the name of a Pseudorandom permutation and the source of randomness.

        The given prpName should be a name of prp algorithm such that OpenSSL provides an encryption with. The following names are valid: For CBC mode of operations: AES and TripleDES. For CTR mode of operations: AES.

        Parameters:
        prpName - the name of a specific Pseudorandom permutation, for example "AES".
        random - a user provided source of randomness.

      • encrypt

        public SymmetricCiphertext encrypt(Plaintext plaintext)
        This function encrypts a plaintext. It lets the system choose the random IV.
        Specified by:
        encrypt in interface SymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        plaintext - should be an instance of ByteArrayPlaintext.
        Returns:
        an IVCiphertext, which contains the IV used and the encrypted data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no secret key was set.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given plaintext is not an instance of ByteArrayPlaintext.

      • encrypt

        public SymmetricCiphertext encrypt(Plaintext plaintext,
                          byte[] iv)
                            throws javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        This function encrypts a plaintext. It lets the user choose the random IV.
        Specified by:
        encrypt in interface SymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        plaintext - should be an instance of ByteArrayPlaintext.
        iv - random bytes to use in the encryption of the message.
        Returns:
        an IVCiphertext, which contains the IV used and the encrypted data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no secret key was set.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given plaintext is not an instance of ByteArrayPlaintext.
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException - if the given IV length is not as the block size.

      • decrypt

        public Plaintext decrypt(SymmetricCiphertext ciphertext)
        Decrypts the given ciphertext using the underlying prp as the block cipher function.
        Specified by:
        decrypt in interface SymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        ciphertext - the given ciphertext to decrypt. MUST be an instance of IVCiphertext.
        Returns:
        the plaintext object containing the decrypted ciphertext.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no secret key was set.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given ciphertext is not an instance of IVCiphertext.
